Tool = script.Parent
local stillEquipped = false
function onEquippedLocal(mouse) stillEquipped = true if mouse == nil then print("Mouse not found") return end while stillEquipped do print("Setting Mouse to go") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunCursor.png" while Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end print("Setting Mouse to wait") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunWaitCursor.png" while not Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end end end
function onUnequippedLocal() stillEquipped = false end
Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquippedLocal) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequippedLocal)

math.randomseed(tick()); math.random()
function waitForChild(parent, childName) while not parent:FindFirstChild(childName) do parent.ChildAdded:wait() end return parent[childName] end
local Tool = script.Parent local Handle = Tool.Handle
local Mouse
local targetChar
local SoundLengths = {313, 282, 314} local SoundNames = {"AnnoyingLaugh", "CarAlarm", "Screams"}
local debris = game:GetService("Debris")
local Target = waitForChild(Tool, "TargetedPart")
function annoy() if not Tool.Enabled then return end Tool.Enabled = false
if Target.Value then targetChar = Target.Value.Parent if targetChar.ClassName == "Hat" then targetChar = targetChar.Parent end Target.Value = nil -- So that we can hit the same person twice in a row if we want. if targetChar:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") then targetHead = targetChar:FindFirstChild("Head") if targetHead then local Megaphone = Handle:Clone() Megaphone.CanCollide = false Megaphone.Name = "MouthMegaphone" Megaphone.Transparency = 0.0 --Just in case Megaphone.CFrame = Handle.CFrame
Handle.Transparency = 1.0 Megaphone.Parent = game.Workspace -- Just in case this script gets destroyed (e.g. if the Tool is lost) before the megaphone gets removed: debris:AddItem(Megaphone, 25)
local deltaPos = targetHead.Position - Megaphone.Position while (deltaPos.magnitude > 5) do Megaphone.Velocity = 50 * deltaPos.unit Megaphone.CFrame = CFrame.new(Megaphone.Position, Megaphone.Position + Megaphone.Velocity) * CFrame.Angles(math.pi/2, math.pi, 0) wait() deltaPos = targetHead.Position - Megaphone.Position end
tick()
local randIndex = math.random(1, 3) local soundLength = SoundLengths[randIndex] local Sound = Megaphone:FindFirstChild(SoundNames[randIndex])
local Motor = Instance.new("Motor") Motor.Part0 = targetHead Motor.Part1 = Megaphone Motor.C0 = CFrame.new() * CFrame.Angles(math.pi/2, 0, 0) Motor.C1 = CFrame.new(0, -deltaPos.magnitude, 0) * CFrame.Angles(math.pi, 0, 0) Motor.MaxVelocity = 0.15 Motor.DesiredAngle = 100 --Just an arbitrary large value, so that it doesn't stop moving. local relPos = targetHead.CFrame:pointToObjectSpace(Megaphone.Position) if relPos.Z < 0 then Motor.CurrentAngle = -math.atan(relPos.X / relPos.Z) else Motor.CurrentAngle = math.pi - math.atan(relPos.X / relPos.Z) end Motor.Parent = Megaphone
if Sound then Sound:Play() end
for i = 1, soundLength do wait() end
Megaphone:Remove() Handle.Transparency = 0.0 end end end Tool.Enabled = true end
function onUnequipped() if Tool.Parent == game.Workspace then Handle.Transparency = 0.0 end end
Target.Changed:connect(annoy) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped)

local Tool = script.Parent
local Mouse local TargetedPart
function onActivated() if Mouse then TargetedPart = Tool:FindFirstChild("TargetedPart") if TargetedPart then TargetedPart.Value = Mouse.Target end end end
function onEquipped(mouse) if mouse then Mouse = mouse end end
Tool.Activated:connect(onActivated) Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquipped)
